albums.name: By The Time I Get To Phoenix

artists.name: Mr. Bungle
artists.note: Mr.Bungle is an experimental rock outfit that started out as a highschool band, they were signed to Warner Music when singer Mike Patton made that a condition to him accepting an offer to join the group 'Faith No More' as their frontmand. Mr.Bungle went on to produce some of the weirdest, most experimental rock of the 90s. They once joked they felt like they could release a blank CD as nobody from Warner was checking their work anyways.

songs.name: Sweet Charity
songs.note: This is the opening track on the album, complete with Mike Pattons signature bombastic vocals. I have no idea what this song is about, but to me it evokes the feeling of the horror-movie trope of being in a remote, beachy town where something is sinister and not quite right.

songs.name: Pink Cigarette
songs.note: This track is maybe the most accessible track Mr. Bungle has ever made. I have no idea what it's about, but it evokes a sense of longing. Just overall a beautiful mix of instruments layered on top of each other.

songs.name: Crutch
songs.note: A lighthearted indie track with great instrumentation. 'Boo' is another great track from this band, that couldn't really fit into the playlist.

songs.name: Non Photo-Blue
songs.note: A lighthearted indie track with great instrumentation. 'Boo' is another great track from this band, that couldn't really fit into the playlist.

artists.name: Zerfas
artists.note: Zerfas was a psych-rock group out of indianapolis. Often described as what would happen if The Beattles leaned more into the psych sound on 'Revolver',

albums.name: Zerfas
albums.note: This project was recorded and released in 1979 as the bands only album. It went on to become an underground classic, with copies of the original vinyl pressing selling for thousands of dollars. Zerfas continued to make music under the name 'Jubal' after its release.

songs.name: Zerfas - You Never Win
songs.note: This is the opening track on the album, dominated by a distorted and heavy riff. The sarcastic and dementing vocals, to me, represent your inner voice at a point when you're most harsh on yourself.

songs.name: The Piper
songs.note: This is the final track on the album, a dreamy and psychedelic track referencing the story of the Pied Piper. If there was ever song Zerfas should have gotten famous for, it's this one. The version played here is a special release, and was not on the original album.
